summary: This is a chain of FBI emails from February 2, 2023, discussing and forwarding information about the civil lawsuit 'Government of the USVI v. JP Morgan Chase' related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails show FBI personnel in New York and San Juan coordinating to identify contacts with information on the Epstein case, and reference the consolidation of the USVI's lawsuit with two other Doe cases against JP Morgan Chase and Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The civil lawsuit filed by the USVI against JP Morgan Chase is related to his activities, alleging the bank failed to follow BSA regulations and alert authorities to criminal acts in USVI jurisdiction.

persons.name: Jed S. Rakoff
persons.context: Signed the order on December 29, 2022, consolidating the USVI's case against JP Morgan Chase with two other related Doe cases for pretrial purposes.

events.title: Deadline for objections to case consolidation
events.description: Deadline set by Judge Rakoff for the plaintiff Government of the USVI to object to the consolidation of its case with two other Doe cases via a joint telephone call to Chambers.

events.title: Order consolidating Epstein-related lawsuits
events.description: Judge Jed S. Rakoff signed an order consolidating the case 'Government of the USVI v. JP Morgan Chase' with 'Doe v. Deutsche Bank' (22-cv-10018) and 'Doe v. JP Morgan Chase & Co.' (22-cv-10019) for all pretrial purposes.

events.title: FBI email coordination on USVI lawsuit
events.description: FBI personnel from the San Juan Division and New York offices exchange emails forwarding information about the USVI's amended complaint against JP Morgan Chase, seeking to identify contacts in NY with information on the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The Government of the United States Virgin Islands (USVI) filed a civil lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase for violations related to Jeffrey Epstein, including the Trafficking Victims Protection Act and Virgin Islands anti-racketeering law.
The lawsuit alleges JP Morgan Chase failed to follow Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) regulations, thus not alerting authorities to criminal acts occurring in USVI jurisdiction connected to Epstein.
The USVI's case was consolidated by court order with two other related cases: 'Doe v. Deutsche Bank' (22-cv-10018) and 'Doe v. JP Morgan Chase & Co.' (22-cv-10019) for pretrial purposes.

FBI personnel from the White Collar Crimes unit in San Juan and the Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Task Force in New York were coordinating via email to identify contacts with information on the Epstein case in relation to this lawsuit.
The email chain shows internal FBI communication and attorney-client privilege/work product notices, indicating the sensitive nature of the discussion regarding the ongoing civil litigation.
